name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

strengths: Hurricane returns Pokemon AND all attached cards to hand
weaknesses: Hurricane doesn't work if it KOs the target
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - Powers attacks quickly
Gust of Wind - Target specific Pokemon for Hurricane
Energy Removal - Further disrupt opponent after Hurricane
counters: High HP Pokemon - Hurricane won't KO them, but they survive

competitiveHistory: Pidgeot's Hurricane was a unique disruption tool that could undo turns of evolution and energy attachment. However, requiring a Stage 2 for this effect limited competitive viability. The free retreat was a nice bonus for switching strategies.

rulings.ruling: Hurricane returns the Defending Pokemon and ALL cards attached to it (Energy, Tools, etc.) to your opponent's hand.
If Hurricane Knocks Out the Defending Pokemon, the Pokemon is not returned to hand - it goes to the discard pile as normal.
If the Defending Pokemon has 30 or less HP remaining, Hurricane will KO it and not trigger the return effect.
